issue.title: gaypornhdfree.com

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [NSFW] [https://gaypornhdfree.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgaypornhdfree.com) ### Comment Username: @MaliceRainbow > There are still ads visible on the website even with abused premium and when I click on videos on the website it pop us new safari tabs that I don’t want > > Is AdGuard premium able to block pop up sites loading or will I need to find something else for that? ### [NSFW] Screenshots
Screenshot 1 [Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/u43Gfyq.jpg)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard/AdGuard Pro for iOS v4.4.4 Browser: | Safari DNS filtering: | server: `AdGuard `
Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base Other extensions used: | None

comment.body:
Hi there, thank you for that information! I did do that actually, but it
still doesn't work. Also, I seem to have a larger issue now. Websites are
still able to detect the ad blocker, as far as I can tell. Now, the custom
filter worked with the AdGuard AdBlock extension when on computer and using
Tampermonkey, but it failed on mobile while also using Userscripts with
Tampermonkey and the AdGuard app. I need to know what the issue is, being
if it's the AdGuard mobile app, or one of the other apps, or the script,
etc.

Thank you for the help!

On Tue, Nov 22, 2022 at 5:36 AM Alex ***@***.***> wrote:

> Cannot reproduce with your settings. I see that ad without AdGuard.
> Please try to disable-enable content blockers in Safari settings and
> restart Safari, and check for filters update.
> Do not close AdGuard window ~60 seconds, because iOS will breaks
> configuration process.
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/135482#issuecomment-1323459838>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/A4HVE6HLZ5OEHUR6MFX52ZDWJSO4RANCNFSM6AAAAAASHLOPWM>
> .
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>

issue.title: bdnews24.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.4

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://bdnews24.com/education/ga09nk1i76

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

In main webpage bdnews24.com
There’s a whitespace at top 

![43E44D02-5F9D-4641-A05E-3ADDFFD55A6D](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46019727/204418830-ca79ec27-95d9-4de6-844c-efa0e461f0f0.png)

And there are two leftovers at bottom of every article

![BC561CFF-72C7-458C-9B2A-838F8020AAA0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46019727/204418895-a43e8c90-1825-4864-b924-945dd49628be.png)


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: watch.foodnetwork.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://watch.foodnetwork.com/video/diners-drive-ins-and-dives-food-network/regional-flavors](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwatch.foodnetwork.com%2Fvideo%2Fdiners-drive-ins-and-dives-food-network%2Fregional-flavors) ### Comment > Although I have enabled AdGuard protection in the Windows app, ads in watch.foodnetwork.com (Food Network GO) are not being blocked, although ads on other websites are. This could be due to Food Network GO embedding ads inside of their videos, making it very hard to detect and block them. This issue also affects Discovery Plus as Discovery+ and Food Network GO have very similar User Interfaces and are both owned by Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/VHV1sj9.jpg)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Windows v7.11.3 Browser: | Chrome AdGuard driver: | WFP Stealth mode: | disabled DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection

Language-specific:
AdGuard Russian Userscripts: | https://userscripts.adtidy.org/release/adguard-extra/1.0/adguard-extra.user.js,
https://userscripts.adtidy.org/release/popup-blocker/2.5/popupblocker.user.js Other extensions used: | Chrome Extensions: uBlock Origin, Malwarebytes Browser Guard Anti-Virus Software: Norton 360
